nodes.text: Menndo was a Rodian bounty hunter who eventually discovered that he could earn a more profitable career with less hassle in assassination and espionage. During the Galactic Civil War, Menndo worked as an expert assassin for the Galactic Empire. He was linked to the deaths of several high-ranking political officers.

The Rodian named Menndo, like most of his species, began his career working as a bounty hunter. However, he later learned that greater profits could be earned with less hassle in the endeavors of assassination and espionage rather than collecting bounties.

Menndo worked for the Galactic Empire during the Galactic Civil War as an expert assassin. He was often hired in the instances a high-ranking political official needed to be eliminated. Menndo was linked to the deaths of several high-ranking political officers during his career.
Menndo was a green-skinned Rodian with black eyes. After discovering his new lucrative career path, he became an expert assassin. Menndo's name translated to "poor" in the Rodese language.
Menndo wore a beige jumpsuit with a reddish vest.

The Rodian bounty hunter Menndo was created for the 1998 PC game Star Wars: Rebellion as one of the playable characters available to the Galactic Empire. In gameplay, Menndo is most appropriately used for assassination missions against Rebel characters, and he is also well suited for conducting espionage missions against heavily defended Rebel installations and systems.

Menndo was later provided an entry in the 2008 The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia based on the character's original biographical information from Star Wars: Rebellion's in-game encyclopedia. The 2003 Wizards of the Coast roleplaying sourcebook Galactic Campaign Guide included the name "Menndo" among a list of Rodian names with a corresponding translation meaning.
